Title: A Nilgai
Description: Walters manuscript leaf W.865, this painting of a nilgai (also called a blue bull or Boselaphus tragocamelus), which is an antelope indigenous to Asia, is attributable to the reign of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan (reigned 1037-1068 AH/AD 1627-1658).
CreditLine: Gift of John and Berthe Ford, 2001
Keywords: Islamic; Mughal; Illustration; Miniature; Painting; India
Provenance: John and Berthe Ford, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 2001, by gift.
Creator: Indian
